question:
Which of the following schemes/projects in India are been funded by the World Bank?
  1. SANKALP
  2. STRIVE
  3. Tejaswini
  4. Nai Manzil
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: Recently, the cabinet committee has approved two new World Bank supported schemes of Rs. 6,655 crore. First is the Skills Acquisition and Knowledge Awareness for Livelihood Promotion (SANKALP) and second is the Skill Strengthening for Industrial Value Enhancement (STRIVE). While SANKALP is Rs 4,455 crore Centrally sponsored scheme including Rs. 3,300 crore loan support from World Bank, STRIVE is a Rs. 2,200 crore - central sector scheme, with half of the scheme outlay as World bank loan assistance. “Nai Manzil” is an initiative by the Union Minister for Minority Affairs. “Tejaswini” is the Socio-Economic Empowerment of Adolescent Girls and Young Women Project. Both these schemes are also funded by the World Bank.
